entities.description: An object used with intent to cause harm or exert force.
Type or category of firearm used, such as handgun, rifle, shotgun, etc.
A firearm capable of automatically loading and firing ammunition.
Weapon category including knives, blunt objects, vehicles, personal weapons, poisons, explosives, etc.
Specific category of poison, including gas.
The unweighted number of occurrences or cases listed in the survey.
Method involving physical blockage of airways to cause harm.
Any device intended to start fires or cause burning.
Substances including drugs, narcotics, or sleeping pills.

relationships.description: Categorizes the type of firearm used as a weapon.
Indicates if the firearm is automatic.
Categorizes weapons that are not firearms.
Lists the frequency of the weapon's occurrence in the survey.
Defines the type of poison used.
Indicates that the weapon uses asphyxiation as a method.
Indicates that the weapon uses fire or incendiary devices.
Indicates the weapon contains drugs, narcotics, or sleeping pills.
